decision_title: CANONICAL — No-Go at Data Readiness Gate (traceability + integrity failures)
decision_question: At the Data Readiness gate, is the tox dataset demonstrably complete, traceable end-to-end, and integrity-reconciled such that downstream analysis and reporting remain defensible?

options_considered.description: Proceed to gate with known gaps; plan remediation after approval.
pros: Reduces immediate disruption to downstream teams
cons: Material traceability gaps may invalidate downstream artifacts
Elevates regulatory and quality risk by accepting unknown error surface
options_considered.estimated_impact: Short-term schedule benefit with high risk of rework and governance reversal.

options_considered.description: No-Go at this gate; require closure of integrity checks, lineage validation, and controlled re-export before re-review.
pros: Protects decision defensibility and reduces downstream rework
Forces explicit closure of risks before proceeding
cons: Likely schedule slip and stakeholder friction
Requires concentrated remediation effort across functions
options_considered.estimated_impact: Short-term delay with reduced cumulative program risk and improved right-first-time posture.

decision_outcome.rationale_summary: The decision is No-Go because the evidence packet cannot support a defensible readiness claim at this time. Multiple traceability and integrity failures were identified: lineage is incomplete for a subset of records, integrity checks did not reconcile across source extracts, and controlled evidence cannot demonstrate stability of the dataset used for analysis. Proceeding would create a high probability of downstream rework and undermine confidence in any outputs derived from the dataset. The program can return to this gate once a controlled re-export is produced, lineage is fully verified, integrity checks reconcile, and closures are documented as controlled evidence.

evidence_items.title: Data completeness and lineage view (shows unresolved lineage breaks)
evidence_items.quality_notes: Dashboard indicates lineage breaks for Study-02 and Study-03 subsets; definitions aligned but lineage evidence incomplete.

evidence_items.title: Controlled tox dataset export (candidate export_v2)
evidence_items.quality_notes: Export contains missing required fields and inconsistent identifiers between source extracts; not stable as a gate-of-record dataset.

evidence_items.title: Data integrity reconciliation report (source extract vs controlled export)
evidence_items.quality_notes: Reconciliation failed: record counts and key identifiers do not reconcile across extracts; root cause not yet isolated.

gaps.gap: Lineage cannot be demonstrated end-to-end for a subset of Study-02 and Study-03 records.
gaps.impact: Traceability failure prevents defensible use of derived analyses and could trigger downstream rework and governance reversal.
gaps.mitigation_plan: Reconstruct lineage with controlled mapping; verify source-to-export transforms; publish lineage validation memo.

gaps.gap: Integrity checks do not reconcile across source extracts and the controlled export (record counts and identifiers mismatch).
gaps.impact: High risk of incorrect analyses and decisions based on unstable or inconsistent data.
gaps.mitigation_plan: Isolate root cause; re-run integrity checks on controlled re-export; document closure in reconciliation report v2.

assumptions.assumption: Root cause is within transformation/mapping steps rather than upstream source corruption.
assumptions.risk_if_wrong: May require upstream remediation, broader timeline impact, and updated governance plan.
assumptions.how_to_verify: Perform controlled re-export directly from validated source extracts; compare identifiers and counts at each step.

key_risks.risk: Proceeding with unresolved integrity reconciliation could invalidate downstream reports and require rework under governance scrutiny.
key_risks.mitigation: No-Go until reconciliation passes and lineage is demonstrably complete; require controlled evidence of closure before re-review.

key_risks.risk: Incomplete lineage could undermine audit defensibility of any derived submissions or internal decisions.
key_risks.mitigation: Produce lineage validation memo linking source → transforms → export; require sign-off prior to gate re-attempt.

risk_assessment.residual_risk_statement: Residual risk is not acceptable at this gate because the dataset cannot be defended as stable, traceable, and integrity-checked. Risk is reduced by pausing and requiring controlled closure evidence before re-review.

approvals.comments: No-Go required. Integrity reconciliation failure and incomplete lineage prevent defensible readiness claim.
Agree No-Go. Re-review once controlled evidence demonstrates closure; reset timeline with governance visibility.

final_signoff.notes: No-Go recorded. Remediation required before returning to gate.

actions.description: Isolate root cause of integrity reconciliation failure and publish reconciliation report v2 with passing checks.
actions.success_criteria: Reconciliation passes: record counts and identifiers match across extracts and controlled export; report v2 stored and linked.

actions.description: Produce controlled re-export (export_v3) with verified mapping and publish lineage validation memo.
actions.success_criteria: End-to-end lineage demonstrable for all required records; memo stored and linked; export_v3 becomes dataset of record.

actions.description: Schedule re-review of Data Readiness gate once closure evidence is complete and linked.
actions.success_criteria: Gate re-review scheduled with evidence packet references; approvers notified.

change_log.summary: No-Go decision finalized with approvals; evidence packet documents integrity and lineage failures.
